comments:
After changing the .gmfgen Gen Editor Generator option "Same File For Diagram And Model" to true I am getting crashes when creating a new diagram.

You can reuse the same stripped down version of my project that I have created for bug 208377 (the second attachment in at https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=208377).

Just change the mentioned option to true and regenerate the diagram code. Then start the new plugin in a runtime workbench.

In the newly started eclipse instance create a new project and in it try to create a new diagram ("New => Other => Examples => Leonardo2-Diagram"). Optionally give it a different name and hit Finish.

You get a "Problem opening" popup whose Details pane states 'Problem: the feature "leonardo2" is not a valid fature'.

Clicking OK leaves you with an empty Editor window that is labeled "Error opening the editor". The Details pane reveals a longish stack dump (see below) but I guess that error is just a consequence of the initial error when creating the new diagram.

The only difference between this and a working example is that changed "Same File For Diagram And Model" option...

Just a wild guess due to the error message: Could it be, that this code erroneously tries to *open* a diagram instead of creating a new one???

Michael

-------------------------------------------------------------
